Breadth-First.Explanation: Hypothesis generation: the model lists possible neighborhoods (Cowgate, New Town) and performs shallow elimination without in-depth verification.

Depth-First.Explanation: Verifying a specific vantage-point hypothesis by matching landscape and architectural features.
Depth-First.KeyElement: Dynamic Earth canopy and grey sandstone tenements indicating National Museum rooftop

Depth-First.Explanation: Detailed clue collection focused on the exact forms of Salisbury Crags, Arthurâ€™s Seat and nearby structures.
Depth-First.KeyElement: Basalt cliffs, rounded summit, white tensile-canopy pavilion

Depth-First.Explanation: Synthesizing verified clues to converge on the Old Town quarter near Chambers Street.
Depth-First.KeyElement: Orientation toward Holyrood Park and Chambers Street view

Depth-First.Explanation: Confirming the final neighborhood-level location based on prior verification.

Breadth-Depth Switch.Explanation: After broad consideration of multiple areas, the reasoning shifts to in-depth verification of a single vantage-point hypothesis.
